repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
It's slightly unclear to me how useful this is - these are all publically accessible read-write attributes that the user could manipulate. However, there isn't a particularly good reason why they would normally.

None of this should be on a performance-critical path though, and cyfunctions are pretty ubiquitous everywhere, so it's probably worthwhile.

comment_data.body: Do the same thing here maybe as well?
This critical section might not be exited, there's a `return NULL` in the middle.
Same for this critical section. There's a `return NULL` here as well.
Same comment for this critical section as well.

commit.message:
Add critical sections/thread safety to CyFunction accessors

It's slightly unclear to me how useful this is - these are all
publically accessible read-write attributes that the user could
manipulate. However, there isn't a particularly good reason why
they would normally.

None of this should be on a performance-critical path though,
and cyfunctions are pretty ubiquitous everywhere, so it's probably
worthwhile.
Simplify some code by wrapping "locked" functions

Avoid lock round PyUnicode_FromFormat

Co-authored-by: Lysandros Nikolaou <lisandrosnik@gmail.com>

milestone.description:
* Remove code for Python 2 and Python < 3.8.
* Integrate better with Python 3.
* Improve support for the Limited API.
* Start supporting GIL-free Python 3.13.
* Support the Py3.13 `sys.monitoring` API.
* Support and use `am_send` for coroutines.

title: Add critical sections/thread safety to CyFunction accessors
